document.docAuthor: Sankaran, Pradeep M. & Sebastian, Pothalil A.
document.masterDocTitle: Redescription of Zoica puellula (Simon, 1898) (Araneae: Lycosidae: Zoicinae) and transfer of Zoica harduarae (Biswas & Roy, 2008) to Agelenidae C. L. Koch, 1837

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redescription of Zoica puellula (Simon, 1898) (Araneae: Lycosidae: Zoicinae) and transfer of Zoica harduarae (Biswas & Roy, 2008) to Agelenidae C. L. Koch, 1837

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Flanona puellula
Simon, 1898 : 349
.
Gravely 1924 : 588
;
Roewer 1960 : 839
, fig. 465;

, figs 236–237.
Zoica puellula
—

, figs 48, 57.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type material.
Lectotype female (here designated) of
Flanona puellula Simon, 1898
from SRI LANKA : Taprobane ( 5o58'03.94''N , 80o25'32.65''E , 0 m alt.) or Galle ( 6o03'12.67''N , 80o13'15.52''E ,
13 m
alt.); collector unknown, possibly E. Simon leg.; no date (
MNHN 16196
). Paralectotype : penultimate female, data as lectotype (all examined based on photographs).

Other material examined. INDIA ,
Kerala
:
Malappuram , Akambadam ( 11o18'37.42''N , 76o12'31.68''E ),
41 m
alt.,
23 August 2013
, M.S. Pradeep leg., from forest litter, by hand, 1 male , 5 females (
ADSH 5101119
), 1 female (
ADSH 5101120
) (all females with egg sac).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Zoica puellula
resembles
Zoica carolinensis Framenau, Berry & Beatty, 2009
, but can be separated by the following combination of characters: Males . Bilobed lateral apophysis (
Z. carolinensis
with unilobed lateral apophysis), tegulum without deep retrolateral excavation near median tegular lobe (tegulum in
Z. carolinensis
with deep retrolateral excavation near median tegular lobe) and tegulum with median tegular lobe and paired additional ventral lobes (tegulum in
Z. carolinensis
with only median tegular lobe). Females . Large median plate (
Z. carolinensis
with small median plate), spermathecal stalk with distal twist (spermathecal stalk in
Z. carolinensis
without twist), large, oval spermathecal head (
Z. carolinensis
with small, circular spermathecal head) and long, longitudinally oriented fertilization duct (fertilization duct in
Z. carolinensis
short, transversely oriented) (compare Figs 3 B–G with
Framenau et al. 2009
: figs 5–8).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Zoica puellula (Simon, 1898)
(MNHN16196). A. Lectotype female (right) and penultimate female paralectotype (left), dorsal. B, C. Epigynum of female lectotype, ventro-prolateral (B) and ventral (C). D Labels from the syntype vial. Figures A–C not to scale. © Elise-Anne Leguin, MNHN, Paris.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Redescription. Male (based on ADSH 5101119) ( Figs 2 A–D). Prosoma brownish, postero-laterally mottled with fine black circular patches. Eye field black; AER very slightly recurved, PER moderately recurved ( Fig. 2 D). Clypeus, chelicerae, sternum, endites, labium, and legs yellowish-brown. Cheliceral promargin with three and retromargin with two teeth; second promarginal tooth the largest. Opisthosoma squarish, hirsute; dorsum and laterals black with numerous small, irregularly scattered white spots; venter greyish. Spinnerets yellowish-brown with black patches. All metatarsi and tarsi without scopulae. Body length 1.93. Prosoma length 1.11, width 0.80. Opisthosoma length 0.82, width 0.63. Eye diameters: ALE 0.02. AME 0.02. PLE 0.05. PME 0.06. Eye interdistances: AME–ALE 0.01. AME–AME 0.01. AME– PME 0.04. PLE–PLE 0.21. PME–PLE 0.05. PME–PME 0.04. Clypeus height at ALE 0.02, at AME 0.02. Chelicerae length 0.39. Measurements of pedipalp and legs. Pedipalp 1.23 [0.41, 0.20, 0.23, 0.39], I 3.00 [0.83, 0.35, 0.68, 0.63, 0.51], II 2.75 [0.81, 0.36, 0.56, 0.61, 0.41], III 2.45 [0.67, 0.31, 0.51, 0.58, 0.38], IV 3.75 [1.02, 0.37, 0.88, 0.95, 0.53]. Leg formula: 4123. Spination of pedipalp: femur 1p, 2d; patella 1d; tibia 1d; cymbium/tarsus 1-2- 1v. Spination of legs: leg I femur 1p, 2d; patella 2d, tibia 1p, 1r, 2-2- 1v ; metatarsus 1p, 2-2- 1v. Leg II femur 1p, 2d, 1r; patella 2d, tibia 2p, 1d, 1-1- 1v ; metatarsus 1p, 1- 2v. Leg III femur 1p, 2d, 1r; patella 2d, tibia 2p, 1d, 2r, 1- 2v ; metatarsus 3p, 3r, 2- 1v. Leg IV femur 1p, 2d, 1r; patella 2d, tibia 2p, 1d, 2r, 1-2- 2v ; metatarsus 3p, 3r, 2- 1v. Pedipalp (
Figs 2
I–K, 3A–E). Pedipalp segments yellowish-brown; cymbium disto-ventrally with four spines, baso-prolaterally with three very long setae (
Figs 2
I, 3A, arrows). Tegulum with a disto-median tegular lobe, with short, paired ventral lobes, a prolateral one narrow and a retrolateral broad ( Fig. 3 E). Lateral apophysis bilobed; anterior lobe slightly longer in prolateral view, with a tiny apicoprolateral projection ( Fig. 3 E). Terminal apophysis short, originating near the basal part of lateral apophysis, lying behind median tegular lobe, its tip with a slight prolateral bend ( Fig. 3 C, E). Conductor broad ( Fig. 3 E). Embolus short, narrow, originating distally from the bulb, concealed entirely by terminal apophysis and tegular lobe ventrally, with a smooth median U-shaped curve ( Fig. 3 E).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Zoica puellula (Simon, 1898)
. A–D. Male habitus (ADSH5101119): A, dorsal; B, ventral; C, retrolateral; D, frontal. E–H. Female (left legs dissected) habitus (ADSH5101120): E, dorsal; F, ventral; G, prolateral; H, frontal. I–K. Male left pedipalp: I, prolateral; J, ventral; K, retrolateral. L–M. Epigynum : L, before clearing, ventral; M, after clearing, ventral. N. Internal female genitalia, dorsal. Scale bars: A–C, E–G 0.5 mm; D, H–N 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 3.
Zoica puellula (Simon, 1898)
(ADSH5101119, ADSH5101120). A–D. Male left pedipalp: A, B, prolateral; C, ventral; D, retrolateral. E. Embolic division, ventro-retrolateral. F. Epigynum , ventral. G. Internal female genitalia, dorsal. H. Schematic course of internal female genitalia, dorsal. I. Female eye arrangement, frontal. Abbreviations: C conductor, CO copulatory opening, E embolus, FD fertilization duct, LA lateral apophysis, MP median plate, MTL median tegular lobe, SH spermathecal head, SS spermathecal stalk, ST subtegulum, TA terminal apophysis, vlTLp prolateral ventral tegular lobe, vlTLr retrolateral ventral tegular lobe. Scale bars: A–G, I 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female (based on ADSH 5101120) ( Figs 2 E–H, 3I ). Like male except the following. Body length 2.53. Prosoma length 1.29, width 0.90. Opisthosoma length 1.24, width 0.75. Eye diameters: ALE 0.03. AME 0.03. PLE 0.06. PME 0.07. Eye interdistances: AME–ALE 0.02. AME–AME 0.02. AME–PME 0.03. PLE–PLE 0.21. PME–PLE 0.05. PME– PME 0.05. Clypeus height at ALE 0.04, at AME 0.04. Chelicerae length 0.41. Measurements of palp and legs. Palp 1.28 [0.43, 0.21, 0.25, 0.39], I 3.01 [0.85, 0.39, 0.62, 0.66, 0.49], II 2.86 [0.81, 0.34, 0.62, 0.62, 0.47], III 2.75 [0.79, 0.35, 0.56, 0.63, 0.42], IV 4.23 [1.15, 0.47, 1.01, 1.05, 0.55]. Spination of palp: femur 2d; patella 2d; tibia 1p, 1d; tarsus 1p, 1v. Spination of legs: leg I femur 1p, 2d; patella 2d; tibia 1p, 1r, 2- 2v ; metatarsus 2p, 2- 1v. Leg II femur 1p, 2d; patella 2d, tibia 2p, 1d, 1r, 1- 1v ; metatarsus 1p, 1r, 1- 1v. Leg III femur 1p, 2d; patella 2d; tibia 2p, 1d, 2r, 1- 1v ; metatarsus 3p, 3r, 2- 1v. Leg IV femur 1p, 2d; patella 2d; tibia 2p, 1d, 2r, 1-1-1- 2v ; metatarsus 3p, 3r, 2- 1v.
Epigynum
( Figs 2 L–N, 3F–H). Median plate hirsute with a straight posterior border ( Figs 2 L–M, 3F). Copulatory openings lie antero-laterally to the median plate. Copulatory duct short, with distal single counterclockwise twist ( Fig. 3 G–H). Spermathecal head oval, lying nearly parallel to each other ( Fig. 3 G). Fertilization ducts very long, lying parallel to spermathecal head, semicircular with a slight median bulge ( Figs 2 N, 3G).

Remarks. In his original description, Simon (1898) mentioned the type locality of
Z. puellula
as Taprobane, but the label contained in the vial of the type specimens shows Galle, which is a city close to Taprobane ( Fig. 1 D, see also Lehtinen & Hippa 1979 ). According to Roewer (1960) and Lehtinen & Hippa (1979) , the
Z. puellula
type series in the MNHN collection contained a female “holotype” together with a male “alloparatype” and several other “paratypes”. However, the MNHN collection currently has only a single tube containing two females (one adult and one penultimate; voucher number 16196, Elise-Anne Leguin, pers. comm.). Although Lehtinen & Hippa (1976) used the word “holotype” to refer to a specific female specimen from the type series, this does not meet the requirements of articles 74.5 and 74.6 of the ICZN (1999) for a lectotype designation. Thus, we herein designate the only adult female found at the MNHN as the lectotype.

The tegular lobes of the male pedipalp were misidentified by Lehtinen & Hippa (1979) as lobes of the conductor, although they are clearly connected to the tegulum, and independent of the conductor ( Fig. 3 E).
Distribution. India and Sri Lanka ( Fig. 4 ).

Natural history. At Malappuram,
Z. puellula
were collected from the forest floor among litter. All females were collected along with a tiny white coloured egg sac of irregular shape, containing 6– 9 eggs .
